reviews.review_msg: Just keep in mind, going into this course he will "NOT" give you any hints on potential type questions for the exams. Not a clear grading criteria. Likes to show off that he knows how to derive equations by writing them on 5 whiteboards, but not a single one in exam. The Assignments are hard, requires a lot of work above and beyond his lecture.

The class overall is not very difficult. The homework questions require some thinking, but if you refer to the lectures notes while doing them, they are manageable. There are also extra credit after every homework. IMO doing the homework also is essential for doing well in the exams. In brief: DO THE HOMEWORK, and youll enjoy this class a lot.
He seems very enthusiastic about the material but lectures and exam were not connected at all, better off reading and understanding all concepts from the book.

Lectures are irrelevant for the most part the key to them would be the last few slides that say learning objectives, study those. Read the textbook, it's absolutely necessary because the lecture notes aren't enough. Overall nice prof

Very nice teacher who seems almost overly polite and wants nothing more to share his knowledge with students.  Powerpoints were good although sometimes would focus too much on derivation understanding of the concepts was less stressed.  Tests had very little math and mainly consisted of ranking things in different orders.  Overall I would recommend
Best chemistry prof I've ever had. Go to lecture and take notes, he knows the subject is difficult and does his absolute best to make it understandable.
Very passionate About chemistry. I am not a guy who interested in physical chem , but Charles makes it fun to learn

The reason you won't pass if you skip class is because he explains the lectures so simply and easy for students to understand. As he teaches, he informs which lecture slides to ignore. Also, I really like how he is all about comprehending the material rather than memorizing formulas.

He is a very organised, very good professor. He is helpful and is there to support you in your learning. He only asks questions worth 1 or 1.5 marks so be prepared for short sharp answers. Hates MCQ's. Difficult class, but at least I actually learnt something in the end.

Prof Walsby is likely the best chem prof for many. Great guy, helpful, nice, punctual and organized. Notes were excellent, assignments hard but midterm + final very much like the assignments so you could prepare, very human teacher hes not expecting computer like brains from the students. Take this guy if available for lecture hes a very good prof.

This teacher has the best notes I have seen so far. His pdf files are complete and not only that, they are legible and understandable. The course itself can be at times hard to understand but Dr. Walsby answers any questions you may have.
cannot ask question directly

*review for Fall 2020* Endless slides of equations with little accompanying explanation. Difficult exams. CHEM260 is never going to be easy, but Dr. Starosta made it more confusing than it needed to be. Also routinely went over time with his recorded lectures (online semester) and was blatantly rude to students in office hours.
He is the best prof I've ever had. Always reply back to the emails quickly. The class was very heavy, but he was always available to help.

Oh boy is this a hard class but I love Dr. Starosta. He is a real gem and really takes the time to explain the material and answer questions. Hes very passionate about the subject and teaching. But be ready for the workload: its equivalent to taking 3 classes its brutal. Also try having ur math credits done before taking this class.

Lecture material was quite interesting and informative. Having some examples would be nice tho. Wording of the HW can be a little vague at times. Exams are quite difficult as they require a very fluent understanding of the material. Quite willing to help you in the class and very passionate about teaching. I have to say MATH 251 should be a pre-req
Whatever you do just look at the slides. His lectures are useless
SO HARD

Do not start HW the night before or you'll stay up until 3am. He kinda overestimated how smart we were. Can be pretty funny in lecture but also completely burn you for getting something wrong (ahem - 1D potential well degeneracy - ahem). His lectures were a lot more involved than txtbook so pay attention. Overall a nice guy but a tough class.

Funny guy but low tolerance for stupidity and he isn't afraid to call you out on it. This is known as getting sta-roasted. Otherwise clear lectures and wants you to be smart so you can do something great someday. HW takes 20/hours a week. Midterms Q's hard to predict. Clear organization of files. Lectures are like 40 slides long. Hard class.

Starosta is a nice guy and is very smart but can't explain very well to the dumber students in class. I did not pass his class because I just couldn't grasp the concepts he was teaching despite going to every lecture, attending office hours and even doing the extra credit take-home midterms he offers for a chance to boost midterm grades by 30%

Becky is pretty cool, she's a bit dorky (gets excited about her excited states you might say), but overall a great prof who enjoys what she does and above all wants to see her students succeed.  I feel bad that I had five other classes to focus on while taking her course.. Hopefully she'll teach me again! (Hard Exams)

I took this course last summer. The course was hard and the exam was even harder, but she is really helpful and always available to help you. The lab was confusing, thank God for her and the TAs who always running around the comp lab to help the students.

Hands down one of the best profs in the Chemistry department. Dr. Leach explains concepts really well, considering that Chem260 is a fairly difficult course. His exams are fair, exams are made to make you think outside the box while also examining the material learned during the course. Would definitely take a class if Dr. Leach is teaching it.

Nice prof, but the materials are too hard to understand, so I am not sure it is his problem or the course materials are too hard. He is willing to help you to clear every single problem on hw and test.

His notes in class are awful, but when I went to his office for help, he was extremely helpful. He was happy to take the time to explain concepts to me several times until I understood it. Often says important things in lecture and doesn't write it down.
He can't teach.  Makes mistakes on his own notes and he can't even copy it correctly out of the book.  He is also color blind
This prof sucks! His notes are just awful.

Chem 266: Average professor overall, downside is he takes a long time to release grades, doesn't usually respond to emails, and has had delayed communication with TA's. However, he is approachable, has good knowledge of course material, and is usually understanding of personal situations and deadlines.

CHEM110

This jokester gives 15 minutes for weekly quizzes of 8-10 questions which require multi-step calculations. For Midterm 2, gave 1 hour for 41 questions - all of which required calculations - and put the highest point value questions (5 points) as the last few questions, so once you got to them you had no time to solve them

AVOID

Declan is a such great prof! Chem 260 is a tough course and he knows that, but he clearly wants his students to do well. He's super approachable outside of class and never makes you feel bad for not understanding a concept or asking lots of questions. Lecture material can be dense, and exams are tough but fair, and he's not a super hard marker.
